meanings.definition: To approach or draw near in space or time.
meanings.sent1: The train was anearing the station slowly.
meanings.sent2: I saw the storm clouds anearing in the distance.
meanings.sent3: The squirrel anearing the bird feeder was in for a surprise.
meanings.sent4: The deadline was anearing like a looming shadow.
meanings.sent5: The sound of footsteps anearing grew louder and louder.

meanings.definition: To come close to in character or quality.
meanings.sent1: Her actions were anearing those of a true leader.
meanings.sent2: The taste of the dish was anearing perfection.
meanings.sent3: The cat's attempt at anearing the dog's bravery was amusing.
